Name: Statue of king Snefru dedicated by Senwosret I
Description: This fragment of statue in sandstone comes from the excavations of W. F. Petrie at Serabit el-Khadim in 1904-1905. It represents king Seneferu (4th Dynasty) sitting on a cubic seat of which three sides bear hieroglyphic signs. The texts inform us that the statue was dedicated by  king Senwosret I (12th Dynasty). The statue is the most ancient testimony from the Sinai of the practice of sovereigns of the 12th Dynasty of establishing a cult of their predecessors.
